elements.title: Jan Kochanowski
elements.contents: ... that Polish Renaissance poet Jan Kochanowski (pictured) – considered "the founding father of Polish literature" – wrote threnodies, the first Polish-language tragedy, and epigrams?

elements.title: Ballo della Regina
elements.contents: ... that George Balanchine choreographed Ballo della Regina to showcase ballerina Merrill Ashley's speed and precision?

elements.title: Elbridge Colby
elements.contents: ... that Elbridge Colby was considered for a top job in Jeb Bush's 2016 presidential campaign, but was not hired after "prominent, interventionist neoconservatives" objected?

elements.title: a murder on a bus
elements.contents: ... that the perpetrator of a murder on a bus once described meeting his victim, who was his girlfriend, to be "like winning the Mark Six"?

elements.title: an old paper mill
elements.contents: ... that the site of an old paper mill is being redeveloped into a residential area dubbed "Tesla town"?

elements.title: represented by a union
elements.contents: ... that the number of employees in the US represented by a union is rising while the proportion of workers represented by a union is decreasing?

elements.title: Mitzura Arghezi
elements.contents: ... that Romanian actress Mitzura Arghezi was once told by her father that her career path held "few satisfactions [...] if you're not a director's wife, a manager's wife, this and that man's girlfriend"?

elements.title: I, Rocket
elements.contents: ... that Ray Bradbury's short story "I, Rocket" won an award 76 years after it was first published?
